meanings.definition: Emitting or giving off light or heat.
meanings.sent1: The emissive stars lit up the night sky beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The sun is an emissive source of warmth and light.
meanings.sent3: The emissive fireflies danced in the dark, creating a magical glow.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so bright, it was almost emissive in its radiance.
meanings.sent5: The emissive glow of the fire pit warmed our hearts on a chilly evening.

meanings.definition: Sending out or producing something, such as radiation or particles.
meanings.sent1: The satellite's emissive of signals helped with communication.
meanings.sent2: The factory's emissive of smoke caused pollution in the area.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to have an endless emissive of colorful scarves.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech had an emissive of promises, but few were kept.
meanings.sent5: The volcano's emissive of lava was a sight to behold from afar.
